title: Lesson 15 Quiz: Sealing, Staining, and Finishing

questions.q: What is the main purpose of sealing wood before staining or finishing?
options: To prevent blotchy absorption and create a smooth base
To speed up drying of stains
questions.answer: To prevent blotchy absorption and create a smooth base

questions.q: Which sealer is best for light-colored woods because it resists yellowing over time?
Which type of stain is thick and works best on vertical surfaces to avoid drips?
What is the main difference between oils (like tung or linseed) and varnishes?
options: Oils penetrate deeply, varnishes stay on the surface for stronger protection
Varnishes are natural, oils are synthetic
Oils always give a glossy finish, varnishes are always matte
Oils require spraying, varnishes require brushing only
questions.answer: Oils penetrate deeply, varnishes stay on the surface for stronger protection

questions.q: If a wood finish turns cloudy or dull, what is the most likely cause?
options: Moisture trapped under the finish or poor preparation
questions.answer: Moisture trapped under the finish or poor preparation
